original_title: Sri Lanka’s state-run LP gas firm reduces prices on easing global price
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s state-run Litro Gas Lanka Limited reduced cooking gas prices from Tuesday midnight in line with the reduction in global LP gas prices, its Chairman Muditha Peiris said.
Commonly used 12.5 kg gas cylinder will be reduced by 1005 rupees to 3,738 rupees while the price of a 5 kg gas cylinder is reduced by 402 rupees to 1,502 rupees.
Price of a 2.3 kg gas cylinder is reduced by 183 rupees to 700 rupees.
The appreciation of the rupee currency also has helped the price reduction, he said.
The rupee has risen around 15 percent against the US dollar since the last week of February. (Colombo/April04/2023)
